article.headline: Richmond 83, Longwood 72
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- Dan Geriot led five Richmond players in double figures with 19 points Monday and the Spiders connected on 11 of 16 3-pointers to defeat Longwood 83-72. The Spiders (3-0) hit 17 of 23 field goals and 8 of 10 3-pointers in the first half. Richmond rolled to a 17-9 lead in the first eight minutes, hitting 7 of 10 field goals and forcing the Lancers into six turnovers in the first eight possessions. The Spiders led 44-31 at halftime and quickly pushed the margin to 20 before the Lancers (2-3) began a comeback that saw them close to six with 3:13 remaining when Clayton Morgan's layup made the score 76-70. However, Longwood didn't score again until Morgan's layup with 33 seconds remaining. Ryan Butler had 16 points, hitting 5 of 5 field goals and 3 of 3 3-pointers for the Spiders. David Brewster had 13, while Peter Thomas and David Gonzalvez added 12 each. Longwood was lead by Maurice Sumter's 22 points. Morgan had 17, while Kirk Williams and Brandon Giles each had 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
